articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Andrea Shalal, Joe Cash
articles.description: The United States and China have extended a tariff truce for another 90 days, staving off triple-digit duties on each other's goods as U.S. retailers get ready to ramp up inventories ahead of the critical end-of-year holiday season.
articles.title: US, China extend tariff truce by 90 days, staving off surge in duties
